session.title: Simulation for Professional Services Agreement
session.jurisdiction_note: Contract governed by California law, with specific provisions for termination, indemnification, and compliance with federal and state regulations.

timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect upon COMMISSION board approval and notification to proceed
timeline.detailed_description: The Agreement becomes effective only after approval by the COMMISSION governing board and written notification to proceed from the Contract Manager. Work must not commence before this date.
risks: Work performed prior to approval is not reimbursable
Delays in board approval may impact project timeline

timeline.title: Monthly Invoice Submission Deadline
timeline.description: Invoices due within 45 calendar days after work performance
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must submit itemized invoices no later than 45 calendar days after performing work. Invoices must include detailed labor breakdown, expenses, progress reports, and cumulative charges.

timeline.title: Progress Payment Due Date
timeline.description: Payments made monthly in arrears upon approval of services
timeline.detailed_description: COMMISSION makes progress payments no less than monthly in arrears based on satisfactory services and actual allowable costs. Payment requires approval of work and proper invoice submission.

timeline.title: Insurance Compliance Check
timeline.description: Ongoing insurance maintenance and certificate updates required
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must maintain all required insurance coverage throughout term. Certificates must be provided before effective date and updated as policies expire. 30-day notice required for policy cancellations.
risks: Policy lapse may lead to termination
Inadequate coverage exposes both parties to liability

timeline.title: Final Invoice Submission
timeline.description: Final invoice due within 60 days after work acceptance
timeline.detailed_description: CONSULTANT must submit final invoice within 60 calendar days after acceptance of work by Contract Manager. Must include all final costs and completion documentation.
risks: Late submission may delay final payment

timeline.title: Record Retention Period
timeline.description: Records must be maintained for 5 years after final payment
timeline.detailed_description: All books, documents, and accounting records must be maintained for 5 years from date of final payment or until final audit acceptance. Available for inspection by COMMISSION and government auditors.
risks: Non-compliance may lead to audit disputes
Inadequate record keeping may affect future contracts

exit_comparisons.label: Commission Termination for Convenience
exit_comparisons.penalty_text: Allowable costs incurred plus termination costs

narratives.title: Ideal Contract Performance
narratives.subtitle: Full compliance with all terms and timely deliverables
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT performs all services satisfactorily, submits invoices within 45 days, maintains required insurance, and meets all compliance requirements. COMMISSION approves work and makes timely payments. Agreement completes successfully with no disputes.
key_points: All deliverables met according to Scope of Services
financial_impact: Total compensation: As per Fee Schedule up to maximum amount

narratives.title: Insurance Compliance Failure
narratives.subtitle: Lapse in required insurance coverage
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT fails to maintain required insurance policies. COMMISSION issues notice and terminates agreement after 30 days. CONSULTANT liable for reprocurement costs and any damages resulting from coverage gap.
financial_impact: Termination costs: Variable based on reprocurement

narratives.title: Late Deliverable Scenario
narratives.subtitle: Failure to meet project milestones
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT fails to submit required deliverables according to schedule. COMMISSION delays payments and may terminate agreement. CONSULTANT must cure breach within 10 days or face default termination.
financial_impact: Loss of profit on unfinished work

long_term.label: Year 1 - Base Performance
long_term.description: First year costs based on agreed fee schedule up to maximum amount

long_term.label: Year 2 - Extended Term
long_term.description: Potential additional year if agreement amended and extended

long_term.label: Year 3 - Audit Period
long_term.description: Post-completion audit review period with potential additional costs

long_term.label: Year 5 - Record Retention
long_term.description: Final year of mandatory record retention requirements

risk_alerts.message: Insurance Maintenance: Failure to maintain required insurance coverage allows COMMISSION to terminate immediately. CONSULTANT must provide certificates before start and maintain policies throughout term.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Implement insurance tracking system with 45-day renewal reminders and maintain backup policies.

risk_alerts.message: Invoice Timing: Invoices must be submitted within 45 days of work performance. Late submissions may delay payment and affect cash flow.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Establish internal invoice submission process with 30-day buffer to ensure timely filing.

risk_alerts.message: Default Termination: COMMISSION can terminate for default with only 10-day cure period for breaches. This includes any term violation.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Maintain detailed compliance checklist and regular internal audits to identify potential breaches early.

risk_alerts.message: Indemnification Liability: CONSULTANT must indemnify COMMISSION for all claims arising from negligence, including unlimited defense costs and damages.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Ensure adequate liability insurance coverage and implement rigorous safety and quality control protocols.

risk_alerts.message: Record Retention: All records must be maintained for 5 years post-completion and available for audit. Inadequate records may lead to disputes.
risk_alerts.recommendation: Implement document management system with secure storage and easy retrieval capabilities for all contract-related materials.
